Hello, I am the lead programmer of team 7536, we bought a limelight for the off season, but I dont know how to center the chassis with limelight, can you help me with this?

As in turn to a certain point or mount it physically to the robot center?

Have you taken a look at the examples limelight has in their documentation? This might be a good one to read over:

docs.limelightvision.io

Aiming and Ranging With Swerve | Limelight Documentation

See the full example project here

What type of drive train are you using?

We are using Swerve Drive MK4i L2 with Neo motors

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-04-18T16:44:13.441Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":111,"readers_count":110,"score":32.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":463246,"topic_slug":"using-limelight","display_username":"Enishan Eren G√ºc√ºk ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24441,"username":"KH987","name":"Kevin Hjelstrom","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kh987/{size}/182255_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60651,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/using-limelight/463246/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3365101,"name":"Elijah Beard","username":"ebear11","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/439d5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-18T16:49:16.276Z","cooked":"

You can get the X position of your target from the Limelight. I recommend this library to get the values. Then you can use a PID controller to go to the setpoint. You would pass the value of your PID controller to the rotation argument of your swerve drive function.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-04-18T16:49:16.276Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":102,"readers_count":101,"score":25.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":463246,"topic_slug":"using-limelight","display_username":"Elijah Beard","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/LimelightVision/limelightlib-wpijava","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - LimelightVision/limelightlib-wpijava","clicks":10}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":60651,"username":"enishangck","name":"Enishan Eren G√ºc√ºk ","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/a4c791/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5402 Programming MÃ∂eÃ∂nÃ∂tÃ∂oÃ∂rÃ∂ Advisor"},"post_url":"/t/using-limelight/463246/6","custom_user_title":"5402 Programming MÃ∂eÃ∂nÃ∂tÃ∂oÃ∂rÃ∂ Advisor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3365117,"name":"Enishan Eren G√ºc√ºk ","username":"enishangck","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-18T17:13:09.842Z","cooked":"

But what if limelight cant see apriltag

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-04-18T17:13:09.842Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":95,"readers_count":94,"score":24.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":463246,"topic_slug":"using-limelight","display_username":"Enishan Eren G√ºc√ºk ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":56380,"username":"ebear11","name":"Elijah Beard","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/439d5e/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60651,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/using-limelight/463246/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3365128,"name":"Elijah Beard","username":"ebear11","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/439d5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-18T17:23:31.094Z","cooked":"

You can use the getTV function to see if there is a target. If getTV is false you just skip the drive function that follows. If you want to center it to like 90 degrees or 180 or something like that when you can not see a limelight, you can use your swerve gyro to get the robots angle using the same PID controller approach. The setpoint for the PID Controller would just be the angle you want.

Do you have any example code for this

follow1127√ó292 21.9 KB

You can replace the new Translation2d line with a zero. We used that so our robot can strafe while following the note by using the rotation value. Make sure your limelightName is correct! the s_Swerve.drive() function may have to be different depending on your swerve code.
